data.chText: 怒目而视
data.enText: to look at sb/sth in an angry way

data.chText: 他没有喊叫，只是默默地怒视着我。
data.enText: He didn't shout, he just glared at me silently.

data.chText: 发出刺眼的光
data.enText: to shine with a very bright unpleasant light

data.chText: 刺眼的光
炫目的阳光
兔子在耀眼的汽车前灯照射下。
data.enText: The rabbit was caught in the glare of the car's headlights.

data.chText: 这些太阳镜是为减少刺眼的强光而设计的。
data.enText: These sunglasses are designed to reduce glare.

data.chText: 这桩离婚案是在舆论的密切关注下进行的。
data.enText: The divorce was conducted in the full glare of publicity (= with continuous attention from newspapers and television) .

data.chText: （长久的）怒视，瞪眼
含敌意地瞪着某人
data.enText: to give sb a hostile glare

data.text: look ♦ glance ♦ gaze ♦ stare ♦ glimpse ♦ glare

data.chText: 以上各词均表示看的动作。
data.enText: These are all words for an act of looking, when you turn your eyes in a particular direction.

data.chText: 指看、瞧：
data.enText: an act of looking at sb/sth

data.chText: 来，看一看这个。
data.enText: Here, have a look at this.

data.chText: 指匆匆一看、一瞥、扫视：
她偷偷看了看表。
data.enText: She stole a glance at her watch.

data.chText: 指凝视、注视：
data.enText: a long steady look at sb/sth

data.chText: 她在他凝视的目光下感到很尴尬。
data.enText: She felt embarrassed under his steady gaze.

data.chText: 尤指不友善或吃惊的盯、凝视、注视：
data.enText: a long look at sb/sth, especially in a way that is unfriendly or that shows surprise

data.chText: 她面无表情地盯着那官员，耸了耸肩。
data.enText: She gave the officer a blank stare and shrugged her shoulders.

data.chText: 指一瞥、一看：
data.enText: a look at sb/sth for a very short time, when you do not see the person or thing completely

data.chText: 他在人群里一眼瞥见了她。
data.enText: He caught a glimpse of her in the crowd.

data.chText: 指长久的怒视、瞪眼：
data.enText: a long angry look at sb/sth

data.chText: 她敌意地瞪着向她提问的人。
data.enText: She fixed her questioner with a hostile glare.

data.chText: 以上各词均含盯着看、凝视、注视之义。
data.enText: These words all mean to look at sb/sth for a long time.

data.chText: 尤指吃惊、害怕或深思地盯着看、凝视、注视：
data.enText: to look at sb/sth for a long time, especially with surprise or fear, or because you are thinking

data.chText: 我尖叫一声，众人都盯着我看。
尤指吃惊、爱恋或深思地凝视、注视、盯着：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) to look steadily at sb/sth for a long time, especially with surprise or love, or because you are thinking

data.chText: 我们都惊异地注视着马可。
data.enText: We all gazed at Marco in amazement.

data.chText: 尤指看不清楚时仔细看、端详
data.enText: to look closely or carefully at sth, especially when you cannot see it clearly

data.chText: 指怒目而视：
data.enText: to look angrily at sb/sth for a long time

data.chText: 我看了她一眼，她便冷冷地回瞪着我。
data.enText: I looked at her and she glared stonily back.

ex.enText: Lights are blazing in every room.

synonyms.bx: 指猛烈燃烧，火光熊熊；也可以指发出强光。

ex.enText: The fire in the fireplace flamed brightly.

ex.chText: 蜡烛照亮了那间小木屋。
ex.enText: The candle flamed the little wood house.

synonyms.bx: 指燃烧，火焰强度不及 blaze；也可以指照亮某处。

ex.enText: It suddenly flared as the gas was lighted.

ex.chText: 火把的火焰在微风中摇曳。
ex.enText: The torch flared in the breeze.

synonyms.bx: 强调火焰等突然燃烧，发出白光，时间短、不稳定。

d: 突然烧起来；（短暂地）烧旺

ex.enText: The sunlight glared on the sea.

synonyms.bx: 指发出刺眼的强光，照耀在某人或某物上。

ex.chText: 一直把铁条加热到透红。
ex.enText: The iron stick was heated till it glowed.

synonyms.bx: 尤指热的物体发出红光；也可以指人因运动或激动致使脸部等发热、发红。

ex.enText: She sat gazing out the window.

ex.chText: 我告诉她这消息时，她以怀疑的目光注视着我。
ex.enText: She gazed at me in disbelief when I told her the news.

synonyms.bx: 常指长时间无意识地或因好奇、惊讶等而盯着看。

ex.chText: 她的表演使我们惊讶得瞠目结舌。
ex.enText: We gaped in amazement at her performance.

ex.chText: 人们呆呆地看着那个叫姚明的高个子篮球队员。
ex.enText: People were gaping at the tall basketball player, Yao Ming.

synonyms.bx: 指因惊讶或震惊而张着嘴、瞪大眼睛呆看。

ex.chText: 这一对冤家怒目而视，准备打斗。
ex.enText: The rivals are glaring at each other, ready to fight.

ex.chText: 尽管母亲制止了两个女儿打架，她们依然怒视对方。
ex.enText: Although the mother stopped her daughters fighting, they still glared at each other.

synonyms.bx: 指长时间用愤怒的目光凝视着某人或某物。

ex.enText: It is rude to stare at other people.
He was staring out at the sea.

synonyms.bx: 指因生气、惊讶、思考等而瞪大眼睛长时间地注视某人或某物。

tr: a light within the field of vision that is brighter than the brightness to which the eyes are adapted

example: he enjoyed being in the limelight
when Congress investigates it brings the full glare of publicity to the agency

tr: look at with a fixed gaze
example: The girl glared at the man who tried to make a pass at her
The sun glared down on us
The moon glared back at itself from the lake's surface

value.def: If you glare at someone, you look at them with an angry expression on your face.

example.ex: The old woman glared at him...
example.tran: 那个老妇人狠狠地瞪着他。
雅各布瞪着眼睛，嘴里咕哝着什么。

value.def: A glare is an angry, hard, and unfriendly look.

example.ex: His glasses magnified his irritable glare.
example.tran: 他那怒不可遏的眼神在眼镜片下显得愈发逼人。

value.def: If the sun or a light glares, it shines with a very bright light which is difficult to look at.
value.tran: 发出强光；发出刺眼的光芒

value.def: Glare is very bright light that is difficult to look at.

example.tran: 专用眼镜可使强光减弱。

value.def: If someone is in the glare of publicity or public attention, they are constantly being watched and talked about by a lot of people.

example.ex: Norma is said to dislike the glare of publicity...
example.tran: 据说诺尔玛不喜欢被人过多关注。

example.ex: She attacked police in the full glare of TV cameras.
example.tran: 她在电视摄像机的镜头聚焦下公然袭击了警察。
